Package org.carrot2.labs.smartsprites.css

Class CssSyntaxUtils

java.lang.Object
org.carrot2.labs.smartsprites.css.CssSyntaxUtils
public class CssSyntaxUtils extends Object
A few utility methods for processing CSS syntax.

  • Method Summary

    Description

    Extracts CSS properties from the provided String.

    Extracts CSS properties from the provided String and logs warnings to the provided MessageLog.

    Returns the value of a CSS property if it exists, null otherwise.
    static boolean
    hasNonBlankValue(Map<String,CssProperty> properties, String propertyName)
    Returns true if the the provided map contains a property with the specified name that has a non-blank value.

    parseColor(String colorValue, MessageLog messageLog, Color defaultColor)
    Parses a hexadecimal format (#fff or #ffffff) of CSS color into a Color object.

    Converts the provided collection of CSS properties to a Map with keys being property names and values being CssProperty objects.

    Extracts the actual url from the CSS url expression like url('actua_url').

    unpackUrl(String urlValue, MessageLog messageLog)
    Extracts the actual url from the CSS url expression like url('actua_url') and logs warnings to the provided MessageLog.

    • hasNonBlankValue

      public static boolean hasNonBlankValue(Map<String,CssProperty> properties, String propertyName)
      Returns true if the the provided map contains a property with the specified name that has a non-blank value.
      Parameters:
      properties - the properties
      propertyName - the property name
      Returns:
      true, if successful

      public static String unpackUrl(String urlValue, MessageLog messageLog)

      Parameters:
      urlValue - the url value
      messageLog - the message log
      Returns:
      the string

    • parseColor

      public static Color parseColor(String colorValue, MessageLog messageLog, Color defaultColor)
      Parses a hexadecimal format (#fff or #ffffff) of CSS color into a Color object. The RGB format (rgb(100, 0, 0)) is currently not supported. In case of parse errors, the default is returned
      Parameters:
      colorValue - the color value
      messageLog - the message log
      defaultColor - the default color
      Returns:
      the color
